snippet: In a show of defiance that reflected Democrats’ confidence that conservatives had overreached, President Obama called on House Republicans to stop fighting his health care law.
abstract: Pres Obama, in televised speech from Rose Garden, admonishes House Republicans to stop fighting his health care law and reopen the government; fiery speech is seen as show of defiance, reflecting Democrats' confidence that conservatives have overreached after years of budget battles with Obama administration.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and JEREMY W. PETERS

lead_paragraph: In a show of defiance that reflected Democrats’ confidence that conservatives had overreached, President Obama called on House Republicans to stop fighting his health care law.

headline.main: Obama Tells Republicans to ‘Reopen the Government’
headline.print_headline: President Tells Republicans To ‘Reopen the Government’

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
